TunableList.name: entries
TunableList.description: A list of tuples declaring a relationship between days of the week and desire curves.

TunableTuple.description:
The first value is the day of the week that maps to a desired curve of population by time of the day.
days_of_the_week population_desire_by_time_of_day M,Th,F time_curve_1 W,Sa time_curve_2
By production/design request we do not support multiple population curves for the same day. e.g. if you want something special to occur at noon on a Wednesday, make a unique curve for Wednesday and apply the changes to it.

TunableTuple.name: days_of_the_week
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableList.name: walkby_desire_by_time_of_day
TunableList.display: Walkby Desire By Time Of Day
TunableList.description:
Each entry in the map has two columns. The first column is the hour of the day (0-24) that maps to a desired list of population (second column).
The entry with starting hour that is closest to, but before the current hour will be chosen.
Given this tuning: hour_of_day desired_situations 6 [(w1, s1), (w2, s2)] 10 [(w1, s2)] 14 [(w2, s5)] 20 [(w9, s0)]
if the current hour is 11, hour_of_day will be 10 and desired is [(w1, s2)]. if the current hour is 19, hour_of_day will be 14 and desired is [(w2, s5)]. if the current hour is 23, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. if the current hour is 2, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. (uses 20 tuning because it is not 6 yet)
The entries will be automatically sorted by time.

TunableTuple.name: desired_walkby_situations
TunableTuple.description: Tuning that expresses a desire to populate the world with a specific number of Sims and associating them with an entry from available weighted situations.

TunableVariant.name: desired_sim_count
TunableVariant.description: The number of Sims desired to be participating in the situation.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The upper and lower bounds.

TunableTuple.name: random_in_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: disable_churn
Tunable.description:
If checked, we disable churn for this shift change. That means we only fire the situation on shift change, not in between shifts. So if you have a situation in this shift and it ends, we don't spin up another one on the next churn (based on churn interval). Basically means you want a one shot situation, fire and forget.
If unchecked, we will try to maintain the desired number of situations at every churn interval during this shift change.

TunableList.name: weighted_situations
TunableList.description: A weighted list of situations to be used while fulfilling the desired Sim count.

TunableTuple.name: params
TunableTuple.description: Situation creation parameters.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description:
A set of tests that must pass for the situation and weight pair to be available for selection.
*IMPORTANT* The only participants that work are ones available globally, such as Lot and ActiveHousehold. Only use these participant types or use tests that don't rely on any, such as testing all objects via Object Criteria test or testing active zone with the Zone test.

TunableTuple.name: weight_multipliers
TunableTuple.description:
Tunable tested multiplier to apply to weight.
*IMPORTANT* The only participants that work are ones available globally, such as Lot and ActiveHousehold. Only use these participant types or use tests that don't rely on any, such as testing all objects via Object Criteria test or testing active zone with the Zone test.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableList.name: narrative_threshold_links
TunableList.description:
A mapping between the event listener to a narrative link that will be activated if progress of that event type hits the tuned threshold.
For example, if this narrative has the following narrative threshold link:
{ key type: GoldilocksListener value_type: Interval: -10, 10 below_link: TooCold_Goldilocks above_link: TooHot_Goldilocks }
... any Narrative Progression Loot tagged with the GoldilocksListener event will increment this instance's narrative_progression_value. If it ever goes above 10 or below -10, the corresponding narrative is activated and this narrative will complete.
NOTE: All active narratives' progression values begin at 0.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The progression event that triggers the narrative transition if a threshold is met.

TunableVariant.name: above_link
TunableVariant.description: The narrative that is activated if the upper threshold is passed.

TunableVariant.name: below_link
TunableVariant.description: The narrative that is activated if the lower threshold is passed.

TunableTuple.name: interval
TunableTuple.description: The interval defines the upper and lower bound of the narrative thresholds. If any of the thresholds are crossed, the corresponding narrative is activated.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.description: Loots that will be given to all sim_infos when this narrative starts.

Tunable.name: save_lock_tooltip
Tunable.description: The tooltip/message to show on the save lock tooltip while the loots are processing.

TunableList.name: situation_replacements

Tunable.description: A situation that is available for situation replacement.

Tunable.name: replacement
Tunable.description: A situation that is available for situation replacement.

TunableList.name: replacement_tests
TunableList.description: A list of tests. All tests must succeed to pass the TestSet.

TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests properties of a particular zone.

TunableVariant.name: zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Which zone we want to test.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableTuple.name: zone_tests
TunableTuple.description: The tests we wish to run on the zone in question.

TunableVariant.name: business_tests
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test if the specified zone is a business or not.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: Test if the zone is a business, an open business, or a closed business.

TunableTuple.name: is_business
TunableTuple.description: Test if the zone specified by the zone id is a business or not.

TunableTuple.name: is_business_open
TunableTuple.description: Test if the zone specified by the zone id is an open business.

TunableVariant.name: is_apartment
TunableVariant.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is an apartment. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT an apartment. Useful in aspiration tuning, to discriminate between property types in tests of lot value. Allows "Own a House worth X" and "Own an Apartment worth X"

TunableTuple.name: Is_or_is_not_apartment_zone
TunableTuple.display: Is Or Is Not Apartment Zone
TunableTuple.description: Test whether the zone is an apartment or not.

Tunable.name: consider_penthouse_an_apartment
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will consider penthouses to be apartments when testing them against the apartment check.

Tunable.name: is_apartment
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is an apartment. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT an apartment.

TunableVariant.name: is_penthouse
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test whether or not the current zone is a penthouse.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, the zone must be a penthouse. If unchecked, the zone cannot be a penthouse.

Tunable.name: use_source_venue
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will test the source venue instead of the active venue. For example, the Community Lot instead of the active Marketplace. Testing the active venue is the default.

TunableVariant.name: venue_tier
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify that the zone's venue is at the tuned tier. If "no valid tier" is selected, this test will be True if either the current venue doesn't have tiers or if it does but it doesn't currently meet any of their requirements.

Tunable.name: tier_number
Tunable.description: The index of the tier to test. This test will return true if this tier is active and false otherwise. This should be the index of the tier in the tier list and not any player-facing index. For instance, if a tier list had a single tier, that tier would be 0, and if a second tier were added, that second tier would be 1.

TunableVariant.name: venue_type
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the zone's venue type is allowed or disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The zone's venue type must pass the whitelist and blacklist to pass the test.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

Tunable.description: Allowed and disallowed venue types.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

Tunable.description: Allowed and disallowed venue types.

TunableVariant.name: was_owner_household_changed
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test if the lot owner household for the specified zone was changed between when the zone was saved and when it was loaded.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone's owner household was changed between when the zone was saved and when it was loaded. If unchecked, test will pass if the zone's owner household was NOT changed between when the zone was saved and when it was loaded.

TunableVariant.name: world_tests
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we test if specified zone is or is not in the specified world(s)

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Pass if zone is in one of the worlds in the whitelist, or fail if it is any of the worlds in the blacklist.
